subject: URGENT: Your account has been suspended
body:
Dear Customer,

We noticed unusual activity on your account. Please click the link below to verify your identity or your account will be permanently locked in 24 hours.


Verify Account Now
explanation: Look closely at the sender address: 'paypa1-update.com' uses a number '1' instead of an 'l'. It also uses threatening language ('permanently locked') to create a false sense of urgency.

subject: Updated Holiday Schedule for 2026
body:
Hi Team,

Please find the updated holiday schedule for this year attached to the employee portal. Let us know if you have any questions.


Best,
Human Resources
explanation: This is a safe internal email. The sender domain matches the company, there is no urgent action required, and it doesn't ask for personal credentials.

subject: Mandatory Software Update
body:
All employees must install the latest security patch by end of day. Download the executable file below to update your system.


Download Patch.exe
explanation: Real IT departments usually push updates automatically. Downloading an '.exe' file directly from an email link is a classic malware delivery tactic.
